title: Maruti Grand Vitara hybrid discounts cross Rs 1.5 lakh in May
description: Maruti Nexa dealers across India are offering a range of benefits and discounts on all the models in the portfolio. Buyers can avail of cash discounts alongside exchange and scrappage offers on models such as the Fronx, Baleno, Grand Vitara, Ignis, XL6, Invicto, Ciaz and Jimny. Read on to know how much you could save on a new Nexa car in May 2025. Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for the exact figures. Maruti Grand Vitara discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 1.7 lakh As some dealers still have MY2024 stock of the Maruti Grand Vitara, those units have the maximum discount, particularly the 116hp strong hybrid variants. The benefits include a cash discount of up to Rs 70,000, an extended warranty worth up to Rs 35,000 and a scrappage bonus of up to Rs 65,000. The maximum benefit for the MY2024 petrol variants powered by a 103hp 1.5-litre engine is up to Rs 1.15 lakh. For MY2025 Grand Vitaras, the benefit is up to Rs 1.25 lakh for hybrids and up to Rs 60,000 for the petrol variants. This rival to the Hyundai Creta, Kia Seltos, Skoda Kushaq and other midsize SUVs is currently priced between Rs 11.42 lakh and Rs 20.52 lakh. Maruti Invicto discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 1.4 lakh Maruti Suzuki’s version of the Toyota Innova Hycross is only available with the 186hp petrol-electric hybrid powertrain, and the benefits this month are higher than in April. The top-spec Maruti Invicto Alpha+ variant comes with up to Rs 1.4 lakh total discounts, while the Zeta+ variant – available in 7-seat and 8-seat configurations – is up to Rs 1.15 lakh off. The Invicto is currently priced between Rs 25.51 lakh and Rs 29.22 lakh. Maruti Jimny discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 1 lakh Maruti’s lifestyle SUV, the Jimny, is available with a flat cash discount of up to Rs 1 lakh, albeit only for the top-spec Alpha variant. Like last month, there are no benefits with the lower-spec Zeta variant. The Maruti Jimny packs a 105hp 1.5-litre petrol engine with a manual or an automatic gearbox, and it gets 4x4 tech as standard. The Mahindra Thar rival is currently priced from Rs 12.76 lakh to Rs 14.81 lakh. Maruti Fronx discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 93,000 The Maruti Fronx Turbo variants, which come with the 100hp 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine, are available with maximum benefits this month, thanks to a cash discount and an exchange or a scrappage bonus, along with Rs 43,000 worth of Velocity Edition accessories. The higher Fronx trims powered by the 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine and AMT gearbox come with up to Rs 35,000 discount, while mid-spec variants have up to Rs 22,000 off. With the base Fronx Sigma and CNG variants, one can only get up to Rs 15,000 in exchange or scrappage bonuses. The prices for this rival to the Maruti Brezza, Mahindra XUV 3XO and Tata Nexon range between Rs 7.55 lakh and Rs 12.91 lakh. Maruti Ignis discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 60,000 While the discount on the Maruti Ignis’ AMT-equipped variants is the same Rs 60,000 as last month, manual transmission trims are up to Rs 55,000 off in May. The tall-boy hatchback is priced between Rs 5.85 lakh and Rs 8.12 lakh, and it shares its 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine and manual and AMT gearbox options with the lower variants of the Fronx. Maruti Baleno discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 55,000 Maruti’s answer to the Tata Altroz and Hyundai i20 is available with benefits of up to Rs 55,000, with maximum offers on the AMT-equipped and the base Baleno Sigma variants. The discount on all other variants, including the CNG version, is up to Rs 50,000. The Baleno, too, packs the 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine that powers the Ignis, and it currently costs Rs 6.70 lakh-9.92 lakh. Maruti Ciaz discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 50,000 While the Maruti Ciaz will be discontinued soon, some dealers still have stock of this sedan that rivals the Hyundai Verna, Honda City, Skoda Slavia and Volkswagen Virtus. All the Ciaz variants are available with benefits to the tune of Rs 50,000. Currently, it is the only sedan in Maruti’s Nexa portfolio and is priced between Rs 9.42 lakh and Rs 12.31 lakh. Maruti XL6 discounts in May 2025 Save up to Rs 25,000 The more premium version of the Maruti Ertiga is available with just up to Rs 25,000 scrappage and/or exchange bonus. The Maruti XL6 is essentially a 6-seat, more luxurious Ertiga and shares the same 103hp 1.5-litre petrol engine with the MPV and the Ciaz. The XL6 rivals the Kia Carens and the recently launched Carens Clavis and is priced in the Rs 11.84 lakh-14.84 lakh range. All prices, ex-showroom, Delhi. IMAGE SOURCE: Yatin Kotlia via YouTube Also see: Honda Elevate gets discounts worth Rs 70,000 and above in May Maruti Wagon R, Swift and Celerio get up to Rs 65,000 off this month Used Toyota Glanza prices similar or lower than Maruti Baleno: Autocar-Spinny study
author: Rivan RS

html:
Every Maruti Nexa car comes with benefits and discounts this month.

Maruti Nexa dealers across India are offering a range of benefits and discounts on all the models in the portfolio. Buyers can avail of cash discounts alongside exchange and scrappage offers on models such as the Fronx, Baleno, Grand Vitara, Ignis, XL6, Invicto, Ciaz and Jimny. Read on to know how much you could save on a new Nexa car in May 2025.

Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for the exact figures.

Maruti Grand Vitara discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 1.7 lakh

As some dealers still have MY2024 stock of the Maruti Grand Vitara, those units have the maximum discount, particularly the 116hp strong hybrid variants. The benefits include a cash discount of up to Rs 70,000, an extended warranty worth up to Rs 35,000 and a scrappage bonus of up to Rs 65,000. The maximum benefit for the MY2024 petrol variants powered by a 103hp 1.5-litre engine is up to Rs 1.15 lakh. For MY2025 Grand Vitaras, the benefit is up to Rs 1.25 lakh for hybrids and up to Rs 60,000 for the petrol variants. This rival to the Hyundai Creta, Kia Seltos, Skoda Kushaq and other midsize SUVs is currently priced between Rs 11.42 lakh and Rs 20.52 lakh.

Maruti Invicto discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 1.4 lakh

Maruti Suzuki’s version of the Toyota Innova Hycross is only available with the 186hp petrol-electric hybrid powertrain, and the benefits this month are higher than in April. The top-spec Maruti Invicto Alpha+ variant comes with up to Rs 1.4 lakh total discounts, while the Zeta+ variant – available in 7-seat and 8-seat configurations – is up to Rs 1.15 lakh off. The Invicto is currently priced between Rs 25.51 lakh and Rs 29.22 lakh.

Maruti Jimny discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 1 lakh

Maruti’s lifestyle SUV, the Jimny, is available with a flat cash discount of up to Rs 1 lakh, albeit only for the top-spec Alpha variant. Like last month, there are no benefits with the lower-spec Zeta variant. The Maruti Jimny packs a 105hp 1.5-litre petrol engine with a manual or an automatic gearbox, and it gets 4x4 tech as standard. The Mahindra Thar rival is currently priced from Rs 12.76 lakh to Rs 14.81 lakh.

Maruti Fronx discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 93,000

The Maruti Fronx Turbo variants, which come with the 100hp 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine, are available with maximum benefits this month, thanks to a cash discount and an exchange or a scrappage bonus, along with Rs 43,000 worth of Velocity Edition accessories. The higher Fronx trims powered by the 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine and AMT gearbox come with up to Rs 35,000 discount, while mid-spec variants have up to Rs 22,000 off. With the base Fronx Sigma and CNG variants, one can only get up to Rs 15,000 in exchange or scrappage bonuses. The prices for this rival to the Maruti Brezza, Mahindra XUV 3XO and Tata Nexon range between Rs 7.55 lakh and Rs 12.91 lakh.

Maruti Ignis discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 60,000

While the discount on the Maruti Ignis’ AMT-equipped variants is the same Rs 60,000 as last month, manual transmission trims are up to Rs 55,000 off in May. The tall-boy hatchback is priced between Rs 5.85 lakh and Rs 8.12 lakh, and it shares its 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine and manual and AMT gearbox options with the lower variants of the Fronx.

Maruti Baleno discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 55,000

Maruti’s answer to the Tata Altroz and Hyundai i20 is available with benefits of up to Rs 55,000, with maximum offers on the AMT-equipped and the base Baleno Sigma variants. The discount on all other variants, including the CNG version, is up to Rs 50,000. The Baleno, too, packs the 90hp 1.2-litre petrol engine that powers the Ignis, and it currently costs Rs 6.70 lakh-9.92 lakh.

Maruti Ciaz discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 50,000

While the Maruti Ciaz will be discontinued soon, some dealers still have stock of this sedan that rivals the Hyundai Verna, Honda City, Skoda Slavia and Volkswagen Virtus. All the Ciaz variants are available with benefits to the tune of Rs 50,000. Currently, it is the only sedan in Maruti’s Nexa portfolio and is priced between Rs 9.42 lakh and Rs 12.31 lakh.

Maruti XL6 discounts in May 2025

Save up to Rs 25,000

The more premium version of the Maruti Ertiga is available with just up to Rs 25,000 scrappage and/or exchange bonus. The Maruti XL6 is essentially a 6-seat, more luxurious Ertiga and shares the same 103hp 1.5-litre petrol engine with the MPV and the Ciaz. The XL6 rivals the Kia Carens and the recently launched Carens Clavis and is priced in the Rs 11.84 lakh-14.84 lakh range.

All prices, ex-showroom, Delhi.

IMAGE SOURCE: Yatin Kotlia via YouTube
